definition: coming and going alone (idiom); a lone operator/keeping to oneself/unsociable/maverick
alone/independent/single/sole/only
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
alone/independent/single/sole/only
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: When you are a loner, you frighten people.
sentences.chinese: 可是當你獨來獨往，那他們就會怕你了。

sentences.english: God has not meant for anyone to go through life alone.
sentences.chinese: 上帝沒有意願讓任何人在生活中獨來獨往。

sentences.english: Dogs, by nature, are not loners.
sentences.chinese: 狗，天性就不喜獨來獨往。

sentences.english: Police said Auvinen is from Tuusula and who acted alone.
sentences.chinese: 警方說奧維寧來自圖蘇拉，平日獨來獨往。

sentences.english: You're always alone unless forced to be with other people and you love to cause trouble.
sentences.chinese: 除非逼不得已，你總是獨來獨往，而你喜歡製造麻煩。

sentences.english: Like the hyena, it hunts for food at night, almost always alone.
sentences.chinese: 它像鬣狗一樣，夜晚捕食，幾乎總是獨來獨往。

definition: to go into a huff
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
affectionate/an affectionate person
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
sloppy
animals
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
sometimes good, sometimes bad
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
unpleasant to the eye/objectionable
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
Heaven knows!
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
